description: From Late Latin extemporāneus, from Latin ex tempore (“impromptu”).

adjectives.description: extemporaneous (comparative more extemporaneous, superlative most extemporaneous)

entries.meaning: With inadequate preparation or without advance thought; offhand.
examples: Synonyms: off-the-cuff, (archaic) extemporal, improvised; see also Thesaurus:impromptu
